employment_agreements.description: Non-compete clauses with excessive duration (>2 years) or geographic scope (nationwide/worldwide)
employment_agreements.recommendation: Negotiate to limit duration to 6-12 months and geographic scope to relevant market area

employment_agreements.description: Termination 'for cause' without clear definition of what constitutes cause
employment_agreements.recommendation: Request specific enumeration of termination causes with cure periods

employment_agreements.description: Assignment of all intellectual property including work done outside office hours
employment_agreements.recommendation: Limit IP assignment to work directly related to job duties during work hours

employment_agreements.description: Contract doesn't mention statutory benefits like Provident Fund and Gratuity
employment_agreements.recommendation: Ensure all statutory benefits are explicitly mentioned per applicable labor laws

employment_agreements.description: Employer has shorter notice period than employee
employment_agreements.recommendation: Negotiate equal notice periods for both parties

vendor_contracts.description: No cap on vendor's liability for damages
No specific delivery dates or milestones defined
vendor_contracts.recommendation: Include detailed delivery schedule with specific dates and acceptance criteria

vendor_contracts.description: Prices can be increased unilaterally without cap
vendor_contracts.recommendation: Cap annual price increases (e.g., to inflation rate) and require advance notice

vendor_contracts.description: No clear quality specifications or acceptance criteria
vendor_contracts.recommendation: Define detailed quality standards, testing procedures, and rejection rights

lease_agreements.description: Lock-in period longer than 11 months without exit options
lease_agreements.recommendation: Negotiate reasonable lock-in (6-11 months) with early termination provisions

lease_agreements.description: No clear division of maintenance responsibilities between lessor and lessee
lease_agreements.recommendation: Explicitly define who is responsible for structural vs. regular maintenance

lease_agreements.description: Annual rent increase exceeds market norms (>10%)
lease_agreements.recommendation: Negotiate reasonable escalation (5-8% annually) tied to market rates

lease_agreements.description: Entire security deposit forfeited for minor breaches
lease_agreements.recommendation: Limit forfeiture to actual damages with itemized deductions

service_contracts.description: Client can add work without additional payment
service_contracts.recommendation: Include change order process with pricing for additional work

service_contracts.description: Service level agreements with impossible uptime guarantees (99.99%+)
service_contracts.recommendation: Negotiate realistic SLAs with reasonable penalties

service_contracts.description: One-sided indemnification covering all claims regardless of fault
service_contracts.recommendation: Limit indemnification to claims arising from party's own negligence or breach
Limit confidentiality period to 3-5 years post-termination

partnership_deeds.description: Profit sharing ratio not clearly defined or subject to change
partnership_deeds.recommendation: Clearly define profit/loss sharing ratios with amendment procedures

partnership_deeds.description: No clear process for partner exit or buyout
partnership_deeds.recommendation: Include detailed exit provisions with valuation methodology

partnership_deeds.description: Partners personally liable for all partnership debts
partnership_deeds.recommendation: Consider LLP structure or include liability caps and insurance requirements

indian_sme_specific_issues.description: Contract doesn't address stamp duty requirements
indian_sme_specific_issues.recommendation: Specify which party bears stamp duty and ensure proper stamping for enforceability

indian_sme_specific_issues.description: Dispute resolution in foreign courts/arbitration seats
indian_sme_specific_issues.recommendation: Negotiate Indian jurisdiction for cost-effective dispute resolution

indian_sme_specific_issues.description: Payments in foreign currency without hedging provisions
indian_sme_specific_issues.recommendation: Include currency fluctuation provisions or INR payment options

indian_sme_specific_issues.description: No clarity on GST applicability and responsibility
indian_sme_specific_issues.recommendation: Clearly specify GST treatment and which party bears the tax

indian_sme_specific_issues.description: No provisions for TDS deduction as required by Income Tax Act
indian_sme_specific_issues.recommendation: Include TDS deduction provisions with proper documentation requirements

red_flag_phrases: at its own cost and expense
indemnify and hold harmless from any and all claims

general: Always request a redline version showing changes from standard template
Never sign under pressure - take time to review
Get legal review for contracts above INR 10 lakhs
Keep copies of all correspondence during negotiation
